sentences.english: The mother tiptoed into the room for fear that she should wake up her sleeping baby.
sentences.chinese: 母親踮起腳尖走進房間，惟恐驚醒正在熟睡的寶寶。

sentences.english: Shujie was asleep in baby carriage, his mother kept watch by side.
sentences.chinese: 舒哲在嬰兒車上熟睡，他的母親守護在車邊。

sentences.english: Even while the earth sleeps we travel.
sentences.chinese: 我們會日夜兼程，即便大地還在熟睡。

sentences.english: The postman comes at 6.30 in the morning, at which time I am usually fast asleep.
sentences.chinese: 郵遞員早晨六點半就到，而這時我通常還熟睡着呢。

sentences.english: I was aroused from my deep sleep by a loud scream.
sentences.chinese: 一聲尖叫把我從熟睡中喚醒。

sentences.english: Buckwheat Hull Pillows are good for back, side and stomach sleepers.
sentences.chinese: 蕎麥殼枕頭可治療背部和腹部一邊熟睡。

sentences.english: Her arm pillowed the sleeping child.
sentences.chinese: 她的手臂給熟睡的孩子枕着。

sentences.english: He had a legendary ability to learn while slumbering .
sentences.chinese: 他有一項傳奇式的本領，就是在熟睡中學習。

sentences.english: Buy some naughty board games to play when the kids are asleep.
sentences.chinese: 買一些調皮遊戲道具，在孩子熟睡之後玩。

sentences.english: Those fast asleep people were waked up by the terrible screams.
sentences.chinese: 熟睡着的人們都被可怕的尖叫聲吵醒了。

sentences.english: I saw a girl who was sleeping in the waiting room.
sentences.chinese: 在候車室我看見一個熟睡的女孩。

sentences.english: As soon as the machine indicates that the dream is over, a buzzer wakens the sleeper.
sentences.chinese: 要是機器顯示夢已結束，蜂音器便喚醒熟睡者。

sentences.english: The only thing worth stealing is a kiss from a sleeping child.
sentences.chinese: 唯一值得偷的東西是熟睡孩子的吻。

sentences.english: As the thunder started the sleeping children began to stir.
sentences.chinese: 隨着雷聲大作，熟睡的孩子們開始亂作一團。

sentences.english: They stared at the sleeping baby.
sentences.chinese: 他們盯着這個熟睡的孩子。

sentences.english: It would take about 4 cups of coffee to raise a normal sleepers metabolism to the same rate.
sentences.chinese: 要花約四杯咖啡熟睡的正常代謝，提高到同一水平。

definition: to sleep soundly/to fall into a deep sleep
to rouse/to be woken by sth/to wake with a start/to sleep lightly
to awaken/to wake sb up/to rouse
to wake sb up with a noise
to be fast asleep/(fig.) to lie dormant/to lie undiscovered
